education.institution: University of South Florida - Tampa campus
accolades: Pi Mu Epsilon Math Honor Society

work.title: Junior Software Developer
duties: Developed the front-end & backend of a football admin panel which tracks expenditure, wins, and matches assigned to machines.
Designed front-end UI systems such as keyboards, numpads, etc. from scratch using Unity Engine and C#.
Built backend admin panels for live service games using ReactJS, TypeScript, and Docker; worked closely with tech lead to implement live data from client machines to compute payouts.
Performed QA, bug-fixing, and front-end development for a Match-3 mobile game using Phaser 2 and ReactJS.

work.title: Assistant Director of Technology
duties: Expedites renovation of computers in the lab by using market research and hardware benchmark data to request funding, able to replace 40/80 desktops.
Develops training roadmap of 15 most useful lessons to teach staff how to use Microsoft & Adobe products.
Innovates a touch-free check-in/contact tracing system for 120+ patrons a day in the computer lab.
Writes multiple troubleshooting guides for PCs, printers, plotters, USF Provisioned Virtual Computers, and other hardware in the lab.

work.title: Calculus Peer Leader & Tech Lead
duties: Conducted two classes of 45 students each on Calculus 1 with relatable examples to improve comprehension.

Persuaded the Math Department, along with the 3 chairs and associated chairs, to use Discord for online learning, in charge of setting up 11 servers & writing documentations for students and instructors.
Spearheaded the online transition for the Math department during the Coronavirus pandemic.
Collaborated with Professor Scott Grizzard to develop an automated grade-uploading PHP script that can automatically update hundreds of studentsâ€™ grades using Canvas API and MySQL.

work.title: Editor & Research Associate
duties: Researched the nature of social affordance and discussed the possibility of integrating into artificial agents.
Singlehandedly integrated literature on the task-understanding, object-oriented neural network, FOON, and video game modeling into final version of white paper
Coordinated with other researchers on the team for interdisciplinary literature review and integration of findings into proposal submission documents.
Took charge of editing the white paper and full proposal in English, ensuring that everything follows submission guidelines to MURI and AFRL
